Class ec.meta.Liason 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.meta.Liason
public abstract class Liason
extends Object
A Liason is the object that one goes through to transport other objects between objectspaces. It encapsulates all of the rules about what is and what isn't okay for transport.

The current rules are:

object typeare passed by
primitive types (boolean, byte, char, double, float, int, long, short)un/boxing
any implementor of Constdirect reference
honorary Consts: java.lang.{Boolean, Byte, Character, Double, Float, Integer, Long, Short, String, Throwable}direct reference
arrays of any of the above, or arrays of such arrays, etc.direct reference
any zero-length arraydirect reference
any implementor of Encodabledirect reference to the (presumably pass-by-copy) encoded object
arrays of implementors of Encodable, or arrays of such arrays, etc.direct reference to an EncodedObject representing the entire array
any implementor of PassByCopycopy
any other non-array referencedeflection
any other arraycopy of the array structure and deflection at the leaves
void as a return typedirect reference, null

Liason()

addMapping(Object, Object)
Add an explicit transcoding map for target to transcoded.
subclassMakeDeflector(Object, Cla)
Subclasses must define this to do the appropriate thing when the Liason has decided that the given target needs to be deflected.
subclassTranscodeOverride(Object)
Subclasses must define this to do any preliminary checks on a given target.
transcode(Object)
Transcode an object into the form suitable for consumption on the other side of this Liason.

Liason 
 public Liason()

addMapping 
 public void addMapping(Object target,
                        Object transcoded)
Add an explicit transcoding map for target to transcoded.

Parameters:
target - the target in the source objectspace
transcoded - the object in the destination objectspace
transcode 
 public Object transcode(Object target)
Transcode an object into the form suitable for consumption on the other side of this Liason.

Parameters:
target - the object to transcode
Returns:
the transcoded object
subclassTranscodeOverride 
 protected abstract Object subclassTranscodeOverride(Object target)
Subclasses must define this to do any preliminary checks on a given target. If this method returns non-null, then the return value is considered the transcoded value for the given target.

Parameters:
target - the object to transcode
Returns:
nullOk; the transcoded form of the object, or null if the subclass wishes to defer
subclassMakeDeflector 
 protected abstract Object subclassMakeDeflector(Object target,
                                                 Cla deflectorCla)
Subclasses must define this to do the appropriate thing when the Liason has decided that the given target needs to be deflected. The return value is considered the transcoded value for the given target.

Parameters:
target - the object to transcode
deflectorCla - the kind of deflector it should end up as
Returns:
notNull; the transcoded form of the object
